contributors: ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, Caliph, approximately 600-661.
item.title: Hāz̲ā duʻā-yi ṣanamay-i Quraysh az Mawlānā Amīr al-Muʼminīn.
notes: Paper; firm cream colored paper inlaid into gray margin paper, writing enclosed within white, gold, red and green bands, page enclosed near edge on three sides with alternating gold, red, and gold borders; each line of the principal Arabic text in large black characters is enclosed in gold borders; between lines of  main text is a Persian translation in very small characters written in red ink.
Naskhi script (Arabic text); Nastaʻlīq script (Persian text); 6 lines with very small interlinear translation in written area 12.2 x 7 cm.
Contemporary red leather binding with gold embossed borders and medallions front and back.
Colophon: katabahu Abū al-Qāsim al-Shīrāzī 1223, dar Dār al-Sulṭanah-i Tabrīz taḥrīr shud, ṣānahā Allāh ʻan al-ḥidthān.
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
Colophon: كتبه ابو القاسم الشيرازي ١٢٣٣ در دار السلطنة تبريز تحرير شود صانها الله عن الحدثان.
summary: Text of the Shīʻah prayer of ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib titled Duʻa-yi ṣanam-i Quraysh together with an interlinear Persian translation.
medium: 13, 1 leaves (6 lines), bound : paper ; 19.8 x 12.5 cm
other_title: هاذا دعاى صنمي قريش از امير المؤمنين.
Hādhaʼ duʻā-yi ṣanamay-i Quraysh az Mawlānā Amīr al-Muʼminīn.
